intro: Telipogon puruantensis, commonly known as the Pauruná orchid, is a rare and endemic species found in the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and often have a distinctive coloration, which aids in attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Telipogon puruantensis is considered a vulnerable species.
